getOverrideLocation

public java.awt.Point getOverrideLocation()
Description copied from class: AbstractVisualizer
This method was added for Brad Knox on Nov 2009 so that he could make a visualizer that specified a custom location. This is dangerous because if you override the size or location of the visualizer frame, you have to do it in both the agent and environment, otherwise they might overlap or look otherwise dumb. You've been warned.

Overrides:
getOverrideLocation in class AbstractVisualizer
Returns:

getOverrideSize

public java.awt.Dimension getOverrideSize()
Description copied from class: AbstractVisualizer
This method was added for Brad Knox on Nov 2009 so that he could make a visualizer that specified a custom size. This is dangerous because if you override the size or location of the visualizer frame, you have to do it in both the agent and environment, otherwise they might overlap or look otherwise dumb. You've been warned.

Overrides:
getOverrideSize in class AbstractVisualizer
Returns:

wantsDynamicControls

public boolean wantsDynamicControls()
Description copied from class: AbstractVisualizer
This is also for Brad Knox, Nov 2009. If you override this and return false then there will be no genericControlTarget for you to put your controls on. You'll get the space back for visualization.

Overrides:
wantsDynamicControls in class AbstractVisualizer
Returns:
